section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance during any time of the day, including weekdays.
explanation: The agreement states i-on will maintain continuous operation of the hosted site 24/7, but then contradicts this by allowing for maintenance at any time of day, including weekdays. This creates an ambiguity because if maintenance occurs during peak hours, it directly conflicts with the promise of continuous operation.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 20th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999.
explanation: The first sentence requires Customer to pay a monthly fee of $450 but the very next sentence stipulates the payment be paid by the 20th day of each month, beginning in April 1, 1999. The sentences are not in agreement as the first states the monthly fee and the other states the date.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice.
explanation: This section defines the terms of termination of the contract after the contract is completed. One sentence defines the term as giving at least five (5) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. The following sentence states that either party may terminate the agreement effective upon thirty (30) days' written notice. Both sentences do not agree with each other.
